title: Indian actor Urmila Kothare's car runs over metro workers in Mumbai, 1 killed - Gulf News
summary:
Indian Actor Urmila Kothare's Car Runs Over Metro Workers in Mumbai, 1 Killed

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

A tragic accident involving Urmila Kothare's car resulted in the death of one Metro worker and left another seriously injured. The incident occurred near Poinsar Metro station in Kandivali, Mumbai, as Kothare was returning from a film shoot.

  • The car reportedly lost control while speeding, hitting the two laborers.
  • One worker died at the scene, while the other is hospitalized and receiving treatment.
  • Kothare suffered minor injuries, and the driver was severely injured.
  • A case has been registered against the driver, and an investigation is ongoing.
Police indicated that the airbags deployed in time, which likely saved Kothare from more severe injuries.

This incident highlights the dangers of reckless driving and the tragic consequences it can have on innocent lives.
newTitle: Indian Actor Urmila Kothare Involved in Fatal Accident with Metro Workers

Published: December 29, 2024 7:32 AM IST by Sanskruti Nemane

Mika Singh, the well-known singer and producer, shared his troubling experience working with actors Bipasha Basu and Karan Singh Grover during the production of his film Dangerous.

  • Mika initially planned to cast a newcomer but decided to include Bipasha when she expressed interest in working with her husband Karan.
  • Despite staying within budget, the collaboration turned into a nightmare for Mika.
  • The shooting schedule was expected to be one month but extended to two due to ongoing issues.
  • Major conflicts arose including demands for separate hotel rooms and reluctance to perform contractual scenes.
  • Mika advised others to be cautious about producing films given his negative experience.
‚ÄúThey were a married couple so I booked a single room for them. But, they were like, ‚ÄòNo, we need our separate rooms.‚Äô‚Äù - Mika Singh

Ian tougher landscape for smaller producers, Mika vowed to steer clear of film production in the future.
